summary: Science does not understand consciousness; this is an unsolved problem . Consciousness is possible with little to no intelligence, but there is no such thing as intelligence without consciousness . If you don't understand something, can you recreate it?  A lot of companies have been put into a tough spot by the tariff war . CEO Andy Jassy tried to explain how he plans to handle the situation during the company's first-quarter earnings call .  Amazon recently introduced a robot packing machine . It is not a robot replacing humans, but it is a machine that helps them waste less time . Recently, an AI tech startup, Builder AI, backed by Microsoft, went bankrupt .  Amazon seems to be set in the direction of repeating the mistake of "Just Walk Out" deception . Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak gave us his opinion . Amazon is creating a “humanoid park” closed-course environment to test the humanoid robots before testing them on real streets .  Morgan Stanley estimates that Amazon is working on automating its fulfillment costs . The analyst previously estimated that every 10% of US units that go through new robotics-enabled warehouses can drive between $2 billion and $3 billion of annual savings in 2030 .  Amazon's latest big bet may flop, with a price target of $250 . I expect that if the "robots" launch, humans will remotely control them . Whether or not this leads to actual savings is another thing .

Amazon's CFO Brian Olsavsky said the company’s latest forecast reflects ‘the general uncertainty’ in global trade . Retail executives have repeatedly flagged the volatile tariff landscape as a top risk for their operations . The U.S.-China tariff standoff reached a peak earlier this year when import duties on Chinese goods soared to 145% .  More than 80% of Amazon Prime members surveyed in May indicated they plan to shop during Prime Day . Amazon is expected to stretch the sale across four days, doubling last year’s duration . Still, not all brands are equally positioned .  Amazon has said it is pleased with the response from selling partners and is working to help them adapt . But electronics, which have tighter margins and higher exposure to Chinese sourcing, may proceed cautiously . Walmart’s CFO John David Rainey recently warned that tariffs remain “too high”  Analysts say retail strategies for the rest of 2025 will likely hinge on how trade policies evolve . The Trump administration has pushed back against such claims that the current tariff policy is manageable for most businesses . Amazon Web Services isn't betting on one large language model (LLM) winning the AI race . Instead, it's offering customers a buffet of models to choose from . The cloud computing arm of Amazon aims to become the go-to infrastructure layer for the AI economy .  Two years after its launch, Bedrock is now the fastest-growing service offered by AWS . It's why Amazon CEO Andy Jassy sees Bedrock as a core part of the company’s AI growth strategy .  Amazon created the project Bedrock. known as Code Whisperer, launched in 2023 . The team realized they could offer the service for a broader set of use cases . Many analysts don't consider Amazon to be leading the AI race, even though it has ramped up its spending .  In November 2024, Amazon doubled its investment in Anthropic to $8 billion in a deal that requires it to train its large language model, Claude, using primarily AWS’s chips . The deal allows Amazon to prove out its AI training infrastructure and deepen ties with one LLM provider .  Revenue at AWS increased 16.9% to $29.27 billion in Q1, marking the third time in a row it missed analyst estimates despite double-digit growth . The Anthropic partnership underscores a bigger competition AWS may be fighting with chipmakers .  AWS doesn’t break out its costs for AI, CEO Andy Jassy said in February that the “vast majority of that capex spend is on AI for AWS” It’s a bet that Amazon is willing to spend on .  Anthropic is AWS's sole training partner . We also clarified the relationship between CodeWhisperer and Bedrock . We regret the errors .

Beyond retail, recent cyber incidents have also hit social media platform X, theOffice of the Comptroller of the Currency and Hertz .

Amazon set new delivery speed records for Prime members and delivered more items same-day or next-day than in any previous quarter .  Year-to-date, SHOP shares have gained 4.8% while AMZN shares have lost 2.7% . Everyday essentials grew more than twice as fast as the rest of Amazon’s business . Amazon solidified its position as one of the largest grocers in the United States .  The Zacks Consensus Estimate for SHOP’s 2025 earnings is pegged at $1.40 per share, which has declined 3.4% over the past 30 days, indicating a 10.77% increase year over year . Despite market challenges, Amazon’s diverse product offerings, strong global presence, and stronger earnings surprises position it as the better pick .

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy tells Gen Z to stop worrying about knowing what their career will look like in their twenties . Instead, he encourages young people to focus on learning what they want to do . Before starting his 30-year career at Amazon, he tried out jobs like sportscasting, soccer coaching, and investment banking .  After graduating from Harvard in 1990, he tried a number of career paths, including sportscasting, product management, and entrepreneurship . Eventually he decided to go back to school to give an MBA a go and explore entrepreneurship . It was only after graduating fromHarvard Business Schooldid he land his breakout role at Amazon, just months before turning 30 .  Having a high quotient of “WhyQ” is something he said helps careers thrive at Amazon . “An embarrassing amount of how well you do, particularly in your twenties, has to do with attitude,” he said .  After graduating as an undergraduate, Reed Hastings served in the Peace Corps as a high school math teacher in Eswatini, a small country in southern Africa . Bob Iger, the CEO of the WaltDisneyCompany, started his career predicting weather as an on-air meteorologist for a local television station in Ithaca, N.Y., before becoming one of the most notable media executives .  “You learn a lot as a teenager working at McDonald’s. Don’t underestimate the value of that!” This story was originally featured onFortune.com .

Amazon has committed to improve its systems for detecting and addressing fake reviews . The commitments address concerns raised by the CMA regarding "catalogue abuse" Amazon has also agreed to impose penalties on merchants who engage in inflating their ratings through fake reviews or catalogue abuse . Grabangoshuttered in late 2024, it dealt a second major blow to checkout-free shopping following Amazon’s decision to scale back its “Just Walk Out” experiment . “Artificial intelligence will help companies put together the kind of solution that the market needs.”  Zippin and Cantaloupe offer checkout-free systems for retailers and venues such as stadiums . Increasingly, the systems rely on artificial intelligence to recognize customer selections .  Checkout-free payment technology is used in settings where customers want to make purchases quickly . The Tennessee Titans play in Nashville’s Nissan Stadium, which has checkout-free concessions, says a senior vice president .  AiFi is already using artificial intelligence to help stores eliminate the checkout . AiFi’s cashierless system is in 300 stores globally, CEO Steve Carlin said in an interview .  AiFi’s system is more than 99% accurate and advanced enough to be used in any store or supermarket, Carlin says . Lori's Gifts, a chain of gift shops with around 400 locations, uses AiFi to keep its shops open around the clock . Store owners used the kiosks to cut labor costs, professor says .  Grabango is the first store to offer cashierless payments . Amazon Go store in Seattle used Grabango’s ‘Just Walk Out’ system . Grabango wasn’t adding locations fast enough to impress potential investors and secure a needed funding round .  Grabango’s research found shoppers were initially repelled by the technology, but started to prefer checkout-free payments once they use them a few times . Amazon's system also had another major flaw, Talbott said .  Artificial intelligence will help companies put checkout-free systems in more stores, Fenyo predicts . Amazon recently removed checkout-less systems from its own stores, but continued to sell the technology to third parties .  Grabango says it was close, but not quite where it needed to be . Professor: “I've always wondered if it was a solution looking for a problem.” But not everyone is convinced it can work .  Major grocery chains and retailers either did not respond to a request for comment or declined to discuss their use of checkout-free systems . A spokesperson for Giant Food declined to comment .

Lescher added that he plans to continue building and developing his team, tapping Thrive’s existing employee base as well as adding new talent . He did not provide details on when new hires would be brought on or how many .

Shopify has delivered a mind-blowing 3,664% return (as of writing) since going public in 2015 . Shopify could face multiple challenges as it tries to scale its business in the coming years . This article aims to explore the opportunities and risks associated with owning the stock .  Shopify aims to be the preferred partner for merchants, benefiting only when they are successful . With a monthly subscription fee of $29 for its basic plan, a new merchant can open an online store . Shopify takes a transaction fee ranging from 0.2% to 2% for each successful sale .  For the year ending Dec. 31, 2024, Shopify had $178 million in monthly recurring revenue, or $2.1 billion annually, from its monthly subscription fees . This revenue is extremely sticky and likely to continue growing over time . Successful merchants contribute more revenue to Shopify and are also likely to become loyal customers .  Investors must also consider the downside risk of owning the stock . As Shopify continues to grow in size, it may struggle to sustain its historically high growth rates . The silver lining is that Shopify has expanded beyond its online roots to offer omnichannel solutions for merchants .  Amazon could pose a threat to Shopify's ongoing expansion . The recent tariff war has become increasingly burdensome for small and medium-sized sellers to conduct business . If merchants suffer, Shopify will feel the pain since its revenue is closely tied to merchants' success .  Shopify has a solid track record of execution and growth, leveraging its business model and customer-obsessed culture . The tech company must fend off competitors while navigating turbulent macroeconomic situations, such as tariffs . Only those with a long time horizon (more than five years) and a strong conviction should consider buying the stock .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . If you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you’d have $868,615!

E-commerce sales increased 22% year over year in the first quarter, with a 21% increase in the U.S. and a 27% increase for the Sam's Club stores . Walmart's 0.9% (at the current price) dividend isn't high-yielding, but its other qualities are attractive . Walmart has raised its dividend under all kinds of circumstances for the past 53 years .  Walmart stock can bolster your portfolio and create long-term shareholder value . The Motley Fool's total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . Amazon will close its Reno, Nevada, fulfillment center on Aug. 2 . The e-commerce giant announced in October 2024 it would not renew the lease on the facility . The closure will impact 325 employees . Amazon is offering transfer opportunities to affected employees .  Amazon’s expansion of same-day delivery sites is key to its push to increase delivery speeds . During the year, the company delivered more than 9 billion orders via same- or next-day shipping . Employees impacted by the Reno fulfillment center closure will receive advance notice of job openings .  Amazon. currently operates same-day delivery facilities in more than 140 metro areas in the U.S., including Boston, Atlanta, San Francisco and Baton Rouge, Louisiana .
